batch_results.title: NIST AC-1
batch_results.mapping_notes: AC-1 focuses on policy and procedural documentation, which cannot be implemented programmatically using Kubernetes APIs.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-2

new_functions_needed.name: k8s_rbac_account_monitoring
new_functions_needed.rationale: To monitor and manage user accounts and roles programmatically.

new_functions_needed.name: k8s_rbac_account_lifecycle_management
new_functions_needed.rationale: To automate the creation, modification, and deletion of user accounts in accordance with defined policies.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing RBAC functions cover some aspects of account management, but additional functions are needed to fully automate account lifecycle and monitoring.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-3

new_functions_needed.name: k8s_rbac_access_enforcement
new_functions_needed.rationale: To ensure that access enforcement policies are consistently applied across all resources.

batch_results.mapping_notes: While existing functions provide some access control mechanisms, additional enforcement functions are needed for comprehensive coverage.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-4

new_functions_needed.name: k8s_network_flow_control
new_functions_needed.rationale: To programmatically enforce information flow policies within and between Kubernetes clusters.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Network policies provide some control over information flow, but additional functions are needed to enforce complex flow policies.

batch_results.title: NIST AC-5

new_functions_needed.name: k8s_rbac_separation_of_duties
new_functions_needed.rationale: To enforce separation of duties by ensuring that roles and permissions are assigned according to defined policies.

batch_results.mapping_notes: Existing RBAC functions help minimize privilege but do not fully enforce separation of duties without additional role management.

batch_results.title: NIST AT-2
batch_results.mapping_notes: AT-2 focuses on training and awareness, which are not directly implementable via Kubernetes APIs. No programmatic functions can be mapped.

batch_results.title: NIST AT-3
batch_results.mapping_notes: AT-3 involves role-based training, which cannot be enforced or monitored through Kubernetes APIs. No programmatic functions can be mapped.

batch_results.title: NIST AT-4
batch_results.mapping_notes: AT-4 requires documentation and monitoring of training activities, which are outside the scope of Kubernetes API functionalities. No programmatic functions can be mapped.

batch_results.title: NIST AT-5
batch_results.mapping_notes: AT-5 has been withdrawn and incorporated into PM-15, thus no mapping is required.

batch_results.title: NIST AT-6
batch_results.mapping_notes: AT-6 involves providing feedback on training results, which cannot be directly implemented via Kubernetes APIs. No programmatic functions can be mapped.
